issue.title: [feature] add audit log
issue.body:
we need an audit log
- date/time, exception if any, code, result, time, was change detected

this would probably help in the future for debugging/adding new plugins/methods too

comment.body: In audit logs we can also include include config/settings changes. This would help if we have multiple users and roles  https://github.com/dgtlmoon/changedetection.io/issues/724.

issue.title: [feature] Allow more than one watch for a single URL
issue.body:
**Version and OS**
v0.45.3 on linux/docker (armv6)

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I can create multiple watches for a single URL (with different POST requests each) if I use the "Create Copy" feature and then edit the watch settings, but I'm unable to create a new watch using the "Add a new change detection watch" (The URL XXX already exists).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Allow more than one watch for a single URL

**Describe the use-case and give concrete real-world examples**
1. Create a new watch for a URL (http://example.com), change settings to your liking
2. Try adding a new watch for the same URL (http://example.com). It will fail even if you try using the "Edit > Watch" button.
3. To create a new watch for the same URL, find the newly created watch and click "Edit", then use the "Create Copy" button.
4. Back to the home page, find the new copy and click "Edit" to change settings as needed.

**Additional context**
There is an API where the endpoint is a fixed URL, but response depends on the POST body. I need to monitor changes to several requests.

comment.body:
> How about this?
> "This is a duplicated URL. Nonetheless, If you want to add it, press the button again."

yeah this would seem a nice way

**Describe the use-case and give concrete real-world examples**

2. Try adding a new watch for the same URL (http://example.com). It will fail even if you try using the "Edit > Watch" button.
3. To create a new watch for the same URL, find the newly created watch and click "Edit", then use the "Create Copy" button.
4. Back to the home page, find the new copy and click "Edit" to change settings as needed.

**Additional context**
There is an API where the endpoint is a fixed URL, but response depends on the POST body. I need to monitor changes to several requests.

comment.body:
> s adding a # after the url?

hmm no, that seems a bit 'special'

forkee.name: changedetection.io

Designed for simplicity - Simply monitor which websites had a text change for free. Free Open source web page change detection, Website defacement monitoring, Price change and Price Drop notification

issue.title: DEFAULT_BLOCK_ADS=false / Fix Issue #1536 / Update docker-compose.yml
issue.body:
The Env Variable "DEFAULT_BLOCK_ADS=true" seems to cause "Timeout 30000ms exceeded taking page screenshot" errors with playwright fetches on more complex sites. 
Issue is described here: https://github.com/dgtlmoon/changedetection.io/issues/1536 
As suggested in https://github.com/dgtlmoon/changedetection.io/issues/1536#issuecomment-1624918142 Setting the variable to "DEFAULT_BLOCK_ADS=false" fixes this Issue.

comment.body: FYI, wrap playwright container's dns with Pi-hole

issue.title: feat: Support XPath2.0-3.1
issue.body: [Is XPath 3.1 100% upwardly compatible with XPath 2.0?](https://stackoverflow.com/a/62438044/20307768) [What are the differences between versions of XPath (1.0, 2.0, 3.1)](https://stackoverflow.com/a/51377660/20307768) This update allows syntax like this below.(matches and position) `//*[matches(@id,"container")]/section[1]/article[2]/div[2]/table/tbody/tr[position()>3]/td[2]/a[1]` I tested with mine, works well. ~~However, exception catches and so on need to be added. Because I can't test every syntax or exception handling for this app. ex) (The issue in the image is fixed)~~ Also because of incompatibility between XPathes(1.0 vs 2.0), something will work differently. Also, ~~I didn't do tests in the directory, because the tests already failed before I made changes.~~ BTW, I tested this patch with mine, works well. Closes #1631 Closes #1674 #1773

comment.body:
I will make a new minor-release in the next day or two and release that.

Because the current master has a _lot_ of small changes, i want the public to settle with it first

then a few more days after, I will merge this in

issue.title: [feature] 'extract text' feature should offer a way to work multi-line
issue.body:
'extract text' feature should offer a way to work multi-line, and/or provide examples of how it should work across multiline

from https://www.reddit.com/r/changedetectionio/comments/17g7lur/extract_text_from_all_of_final_output/

commits.message: Build - Add piwheels support for ARMv6 and ARMv7 machines (rPi etc) (#1814)

pull_request.title: Add piwheels support for ARMv6 and ARMv7 machines
pull_request.body:
Prebuilt armv6/armv7 wheels are available on piwheels for Python 3.7 (buster), Python 3.9 (bullseye) and soon Python 3.11 (bookworm).

In the future, when changedetection supports Python 3.11 we can unpin some requirements (in requirements.txt) and the build workflow won't fail due to missing Rust (it is required to compile some wheels like `rpds-py`).

(This is a repost of #1782)
